verbs.description: engrieve (third-person singular simple present engrieves, present participle engrieving, simple past and past participle engrieved)

entries.meaning: (archaic, transitive) To cause grief to, to vex or pain; to associate with vexation or pain.
examples: Even in men, aches and hurts and corns do engrieve, either towards rain or towards frost : for the one maketh the humours more to abound ; and the other maketh them sharper.
